overview:
Ulpian Morina is founder of Gurrop (the “data revolutionising” social site still in development). Creator of efpa library, making the Facebook api simpler and less time consuming. Co-founder of getr, the web application that saves webpages and notifies people of the changes that the webpage has had, it allows for collaboration and social connection with people of recommending webpages and organizing them in columns.

He has worked on previous enterprise-level security applications. He is a Linux lover and Free Software / Freedom of information fan.

Ulpian is also the author of “Dodona”, a new encryption script written in PHP that criticizes PGP for it’s “mechanical” way of working and it’s inability to be popular with the common user. His efpa library has caused much controversy over the Facebook source code hack and giving developers a third party api to work with Facebook.

He is currently most active on Gurrop, a social site that promises to resurrect forums and change the way people use and view other people’s opinions. The site is open for people to use but is not recommended to visit until all developments have finalized.
